alert.note: Alert for Addison; Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 4:19AM EDT until July 10 at 7:30AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Addison County in central Vermont... Southeastern Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 730 AM EDT. * At 419 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vergennes, Starksboro, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Hinesburg, Bristol, Buels Gore, Huntington, New Haven, St. George, Lincoln, Charlotte, Richmond, Waltham, Ferrisburgh, Williston, Weybridge, Bolton and Addison. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
